snippet: Significant investments in marketing of crucial brands like Pepsi and Lay’s and strong sales in Latin America and other emerging markets also helped the company.
abstract: PepsiCo reports fourth-quarter profit of $1.66 billion, or $1.06 a share, up 17 percent from $1.42 billion, or 89 cents a share, in year-ago quarter; earnings were helped by higher prices and strong sales in emerging markets.
lead_paragraph: Significant investments in marketing of crucial brands like Pepsi and Lay’s and strong sales in Latin America and other emerging markets also helped the company.

headline.seo: PepsiCo Profit Increases 17% on Higher Prices
headline.main: Higher Prices Help PepsiCo to a 17% Gain in Profit
